flawed_nl_solution:
At a 10 percent discount, Jordyn will pay 10/100%*$5=$0.5 less for a bag of cherries.
To buy one of the cherries at a 10% discount Jordyn will pay $5-$0.5=<<5-0.5=45>>45
The cost of buying 50 bags of cherries at the 10% discount is 50*45=<<50*45=2250>>2250
Also, at a 10% discount, Jordyn will pay 10/100*$7=<<10/100*7=0.7>>0.7 less for a bag of olives.
The price of a bag of olives at a 10% discount is $7-$0.7=<<7-0.7=6.3>>6.3
To buy 50 bags of olives Jordyn will pay $6.3*50=<<6.3*50=315>>315
The total cost of buying 50 bags of each fruit at a 10% discount is $315+$2250=$2565
#### 2565

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 4.5, not 45. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
